intro: Huberia bradeana, commonly known as the Bradean thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its spiny stems and foliage. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
